poem:
**Executive Orders**  

In the quiet dawn of bureaucracy,  
words are shaped into sharp edges,  
paper cuts becoming policies.  

The ink, not yet dry,  
aims to alter the dance of ballots,  
yet the sun still rises,  
indifferent to such drafts,  
mocking the daylight  
with whispers of what truth may  
actually seal and deliver.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Trump says lawyers are drafting executive order to end mail-in voting Donald Trump on Monday announced that lawyers are drafting an executive order to eliminate mail-in voting, days after Vladimir Putin told him US elections were rigged because of postal ballots. In a White House meeting alongside Ukrainian president Volodymyr Zelenskyy, Trump said: “We’re going to start with an executive order that’s being written right now by the best lawyers in the country to end". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
